item.title: 中美关税降级，交易员削减澳央行宽松押注
item.description: 在中美两国同意暂时降低彼此产品关税的连带效应下，交易员们正在逐步减少对澳大利亚采取激进宽松货币政策的押注。【原文：Traders are winding back bets on aggressive monetary easing by Australia in a cascading effect from the US and China agreeing to temporarily lower tariffs on each other’s products.】

item.title: 贸易停战令刺激经济的希望破灭，中国股市下滑
item.description: 中国股市周二在香港下跌，原因是与美国达成的关税休战协议带来的最初乐观情绪，让人们开始担心中国政府不会急于加大刺激经济增长的力度。【原文：Chinese stocks fell in Hong Kong on Tuesday, as initial optimism from the tariff truce with the US gave way to concerns that Beijing won’t feel the need to urgently ramp up growth stimulus.】

item.title: 谷歌在欧洲面临至少 120 亿欧元的民事索赔
item.description:
这家科技巨头因其购物搜索服务被欧盟处以 24 亿欧元的罚款。据称受害者提起的诉讼可能会增加数十亿美元。【原文：

The tech giant was hit with a €2.4 billion fine in the EU over its shopping search service. Suits from alleged victims could add billions more.

】

item.title: Indeed 数据显示外国人对美国招聘信息的兴趣下降
item.description: 科维德-19疫情爆发后，外国对美国工作岗位的兴趣几乎消失殆尽，这种转变有可能加剧医疗保健等行业的劳动力短缺。【原文：The burst of foreign interest in US jobs following the Covid-19 pandemic has all but vanished, a shift that threatens to exacerbate labor shortages in industries such as health care.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦停战，卢比上涨，节后恢复交易
item.description: 印度与巴基斯坦达成停火协议，引发当地股市大涨，印度卢比在长周末后恢复交易，创下近两周来最大涨幅。【原文：The Indian rupee rallied the most in nearly two weeks as trading resumed after a long weekend, supported by a ceasefire agreement with Pakistan that triggered a surge in local stocks.】

item.title: 高盛上调 S&P 500 指数目标，因关税下调和经济衰退风险
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. lifted its US stock targets, as the easing of trade tensions between the US and China fuels a comeback of the “Buy America” trade.】

item.title: 特朗普关税施压，习近平向拉美示好
item.description: 中国国家主席习近平誓言要深化与拉美和加勒比国家的经济合作，并向一些国家提供免签证入境待遇，他试图将中国定位为比美国更好的合作伙伴。【原文：Chinese President Xi Jinping vowed to deepen economic cooperation with Latin American and Caribbean nations and offered visa-free entry to some countries, as he seeks to position China as a better partner than the US.】

item.title: 空头成本创新低，助推港元下滑
item.description: 随着港元疲软至其固定交易区间的中间位置，做空港元的成本已降至历史最低点。【原文：The cost of shorting the Hong Kong dollar has slumped to an all-time low, as the currency weakens to the middle of its fixed trading band.】

item.title: 中国美团将以 10 亿美元预算启动巴西业务
item.description: 路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）希望在中国的帮助下改变巴西依赖大宗商品的经济，美团将在五年内投资 10 亿美元，在巴西启动并扩大食品配送服务。【原文：Meituan will invest $1 billion over five years to start and expand a food delivery service in Brazil, as Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva hopes to transform the country’s commodities-reliant economy with help from China.】

item.title: 贸易提振后铁矿石重拾跌势，前景充满挑战
item.description: 随着中美贸易休战带来的风险升温逐渐消退，铁矿石价格下跌，交易商将注意力重新转向充满挑战的行业背景。【原文：Iron ore fell as a broad, risk-on lift that followed the US-China trade truce faded, with traders turning their attention back to a challenging industry backdrop.】

item.title: Vinpearl 股票在越南首次交易中以限价大涨
item.description: Vinpearl JSC 的股票在首次交易中以最高价跃升，这家越南最大商业帝国的酒店部门成为越南最大的上市公司之一。【原文：Shares of Vinpearl JSC jumped by the limit in their trading debut as the hospitality unit of Vietnam’s largest business empire became one of the country’s biggest listed companies.】

item.title: 摘要显示日本央行在警惕关税的同时仍着眼于加息
item.description: 根据日本央行 4 月 30 日至 5 月 1 日会议的意见摘要，日本央行董事会成员表示有意进一步加息，同时表示需要对美国关税措施的潜在经济影响保持警惕。【原文：Bank of Japan board members signaled their intention for further rate hikes while citing the need to stay vigilant due the potential economic impacts from US tariff measures, according to a summary of opinions from their April 30-May 1 meeting.】

item.title: 收益率上升引发日本 30 年期债券销售的紧张情绪
item.description: 周二，日本将举行 30 年期国债拍卖，交易员们对此惶恐不安，担心会出现国债抛售加剧的迹象。【原文：Traders are jittery going into Japan’s auction of 30-year government bonds Tuesday for any signs of a deepening selloff in the securities.】

item.title: 世界贸易组织（WTO）负责人：关税为世界带来挑战和机遇
item.description: 世界贸易组织总干事恩古齐-奥孔乔-伊韦拉（Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala）认为，全球贸易战及其持续不断的关税发展既带来了挑战，也带来了机遇。【原文：The global trade war with its persistent barrage of tariff developments provides both challenges and opportunities, according to Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala, the Director General of the World Trade Organisation.】

item.description: 野村控股公司（Nomura Holdings Inc.【原文：Nomura Holdings Inc. strategists upgraded Chinese stocks to a ‘tactical overweight,’ saying the trade truce between the US and China is a significant positive for the Asian nation’s equities.】

item.title: 台湾保险公司四月因美元暴跌遭受损失
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）发出全球贸易关税浪潮的警告后，受汇率波动影响，台湾最大的保险公司 4 月份共亏损 187 亿新台币（约合 6.2 亿美元）。【原文：Taiwan’s biggest insurers posted a total loss of NT$18.7 billion ($620 million) in April due to currency volatility after US President Donald Trump warned of a wave of global trade tariffs.】

item.title: 丸红首席执行官与巴菲特就长期合作关系达成一致
item.description: 丸红株式会社（Marubeni Corp. ）的高层确认了该日本贸易公司与伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway Inc.【原文：The top executive at Marubeni Corp. affirmed the Japanese trading house’s commitment to a long-term partnership with Berkshire Hathaway Inc., echoing sentiments recently expressed by the US investment firm.】

item.title: 经济衰退可能性减弱，债券交易员关注通胀以寻找利率线索
item.description: 中美贸易暂时休战降低了经济衰退的可能性，引发了国债抛售，在全球最大经济体的通胀数据公布之前，投资者面临的风险也随之增加。【原文：The temporary US-China trade truce dimmed the odds of a recession and sparked a selloff in Treasuries, raising the stakes for investors ahead of the release of inflation figures for the world’s biggest economy.】

item.title: 韩国保险公司在监管机构反对后停止债券催缴计划
item.description: 韩国一家普通保险公司上周提前赎回债券的计划令投资者感到震惊，在此举招致金融监管机构的迅速斥责后，该公司突然停止了这一计划。【原文：The South Korean general insurer that rattled investors with its early bond redemption plan last week abruptly halted it after the move drew a quick rebuke from the financial regulator.】

item.title: 澳大利亚消费者信心回升，澳大利亚央行有望降息
item.description: 在总理安东尼-阿尔巴内斯（Anthony Albanese）大选取得压倒性胜利后，澳大利亚的消费者信心在 5 月份出现反弹，因为家庭对下周降息的预期日益强烈。【原文：Australia’s consumer confidence rebounded in May following Prime Minister Anthony Albanese’s landslide election victory and as households increasingly expect an interest rate-cut next week.】

item.title: 剑网利润率低成焦点，交易员翘首以待财报
item.description: 这家中国电子商务公司正以高昂的代价进军食品配送领域，在发布财报后，投资者已做好准备，期待遭受重创的 JD.com 公司股价出现大幅震荡。【原文：Investors are prepared for a big jolt in battered shares of JD.com Inc. following an earnings report from the Chinese e-commerce company, which is mounting a costly foray into food delivery.】

item.title: 三星发布售价 1099 美元的 S25 Edge，掀起超薄手机浪潮
item.description: 三星电子公司周一推出了一款超薄型 Galaxy S25 Edge 智能手机，掀起了预计将于今年推出的超薄手机浪潮。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co. on Monday rolled out a slimmed-down Galaxy S25 Edge smartphone, kicking off a wave of drastically thinner handsets expected to launch this year.】

item.title: 市场对中美关系持乐观态度，黄金重挫不改
item.description: 中美贸易紧张局势大幅缓和，损害了避险需求，黄金在大幅下挫后企稳。【原文：Gold steadied after a sharp selloff as a major de-escalation in US-China trade tensions hurt demand for havens.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利主导设计软件制造商 Figma 的首次公开募股
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，设计软件公司 Figma Inc. 聘请摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）领导可能是今年最大的首次公开募股活动之一。【原文：Design software business Figma Inc. hired Morgan Stanley to lead what could be one of the year’s biggest initial public offerings, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 石油在贸易协议收益后保持稳定，焦点转向中东地区
item.description: 随着人们的注意力从中美贸易战的缓和转移到中东，石油价格在连续三天上涨后趋于平稳。【原文：Oil steadied after three days of advances, as attention moved away from the deescalation of the US-China trade war and to the Middle East.】

item.title: Coinbase 下周将加入 S&P 500 指数，成为加密货币市场的里程碑
item.description: 美国最大的加密货币交易所 Coinbase Global Inc. 将被纳入 S&P 500 指数，这是数字资产行业蓬勃发展的最新里程碑。【原文：Coinbase Global Inc., the largest US cryptocurrency exchange, will be added to the S&P 500 Index in the latest milestone for the booming digital-asset industry.】

item.title: 美国 4 月通胀有望回升，关税影响不大
item.description: 美国通胀在上月意外降温后，4 月份可能加速，尤其是对中国商品征收更高的关税开始影响物价。【原文：US inflation likely accelerated in April after an unexpected cooldown the previous month, with higher tariffs on Chinese goods in particular starting to impact prices.】

item.title: 芝加哥利用 Loop Capital 创始人弥补 10 亿美元预算缺口
item.description: Loop Capital 创始人吉姆-雷诺兹（Jim Reynolds）将与他人共同领导一个由芝加哥市长布兰登-约翰逊（Brandon Johnson）成立的工作小组，为该市寻找弥补赤字的方法。【原文：Loop Capital founder Jim Reynolds​​​​ will co-lead a working group established by Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson to find ways for the city to close its deficits that are projected to top $1 billion in each of the next two years.】
